unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Vendor Audits Intensify Post-Diwali Surge**
normalised: Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Vendor Audits Intensify Post Diwali Surge

unnormalised: Mumbai, Nov 15th - Manufacturing companies across India are ramping up vendor audits following the recent Diwali season surge in demand. Several firms, including those in the auto-component and FMCG sectors, are tightening quality control measures across their supply chains.
normalised: Mumbai, November fifteenth - Manufacturing companies across India are ramping up vendor audits following the recent Diwali season surge in demand. Several firms, including those in the auto component and F M C G sectors, are tightening quality control measures across their supply chains.

unnormalised: "Post-festival rush often reveals vulnerabilities," stated Mr. Rajesh Kumar, Supply Chain Head at Mahindra Industries. "We're conducting thorough audits, focusing on raw material sourcing and adherence to quality standards, especially in light of the increased pressure on suppliers to meet deadlines."
normalised: "Post festival rush often reveals vulnerabilities," stated Mister Rajesh Kumar, Supply Chain Head at Mahindra Industries. "We are conducting thorough audits, focusing on raw material sourcing and adherence to quality standards, especially in light of the increased pressure on suppliers to meet deadlines."

unnormalised: Audits in sectors supplying ingredients for traditional delicacies like biryani, which sees heightened consumption during festivals, are particularly rigorous. Checks include verification of certifications like FSSAI and adherence to environmental regulations. A recent audit in Tamil Nadu flagged non-compliance issues regarding water usage for one supplier, resulting in a temporary suspension of deliveries. The industry expects these enhanced audits to continue into the new year. Companies hope these measures will prevent disruptions and maintain product integrity.
